posts.post_content:
@Henrietta: I don't know what you're trying to say there, but I'd go a step forward and say "great" in token decks rather than decent. Token decks are the ones most likely to make this cost the same as [Wrath of God](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wrath of God) except only affect your opponents. And even if you do have to tap all of your creatures to cast this, then you could consider it only "decent," but still, "Tap all your creatures, destroy all your opponent's creatures" is still really good. And in dedicated token decks, say, a [Rhys the Redeemed](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rhys the Redeemed) Commander deck, you won't likely be tapping all of your creatures anyway.  
  
I love this card.
posts.html:

And in dedicated token decks, say, a Rhys the Redeemed Commander deck, you won't likely be tapping all of your creatures anyway.

I love this card.

oh this card is sooo good. i run it in g/w control and first off its easily feasibleto us this turn 4, but i like to sandbag my cards until my opponent starts developing, while i just drop things like tokens and [glare of subdual](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=glare of subdual)   
  
and btw to the guy that said its a drawback to tap all your own creatures? who cares? all yours are tapped; all their creatures are deadz!!
